channel.title: No Nvidia settings (kubuntu 7.04)
channel.description:
Howdy! I haven't been on this board in awhile.. don't remember a 'Linux' section...
Anyway, I have installed Kubuntu(While using it like a live CD, awesome feature) and I want to get both my screens running and maybe beryl going too.
My problem is, in xubuntu I just 'sudo' nvidia-settings but in kubuntu, there isn't really any configurations. I think it might be the driver but, I have tried many and none seem to give me any settings,
My card is a Nvidia geforce FX5500... one of my screens is showing the weird color thing it usually does until I install the nvidia driver(when in xubuntu) usually it just stays blank after I installed it.. but, in K it still does the weird color thing no matter what driver.
Thanks, bumross
EDIT: This is what it says in the terminal when I type 'sudo nvidia-settings' [code]ERROR: NV-CONTROL extension not found on this Display.
ERROR: Unable to determine number of NVIDIA GPUs on ':0.0'.
ERROR: Unable to determine number of NVIDIA Frame Lock Devices on ':0.0'.
ERROR: Unable to determine number of NVIDIA VCSCs on ':0.0'.
X Error: BadDevice, invalid or uninitialized input device 154 Major opcode: 143 Minor opcode: 3 Resource id: 0x0 Failed to open device X Error: BadDevice, invalid or uninitialized input device 154 Major opcode: 143 Minor opcode: 3 Resource id: 0x0 Failed to open device bumross@bumross-kubuntu:~$ [/code]
